20110113140553.000|20110113140555.000|TR0|shot and then Mr. Stoddard jumped in front 
20110113140555.000|20110113140558.000|TR0|of his wife and was shot, and he continued 
20110113140558.000|20110113140600.000|TR0|down -- the gunman continued down the 
20110113140600.000|20110113140603.000|TR0|line.  You have to imagine how small a 
20110113140603.000|20110113140605.000|TR0|space this was.  We were between a brick 
20110113140605.000|20110113140608.000|TR0|wall which was the store and a stanion 
20110113140608.000|20110113140610.000|TR0|which was only a person and a half wide.

20110113140824.000|20110113140827.000|TR0|PHILLIPS:  Well, the attack on 
20110113140827.000|20110113140829.000|TR0|Congresswoman Giffords has prompted top 
20110113140829.000|20110113140832.000|TR0|law enforcement officials on Capitol Hill 
20110113140832.000|20110113140834.000|TR0|now to review security measures and so far 
20110113140834.000|20110113140837.000|TR0|they're not recommending any big changes 
20110113140837.000|20110113140839.000|TR0|to how lawmakers are protected in 
20110113140839.000|20110113140842.000|TR0|Washington or back home in their districts.
20110113140842.000|20110113140844.000|TR0|
20110113140844.000|20110113140847.000|TR0|They're urging lawmakers to adhere to 
20110113140847.000|20110113140849.000|TR0|existing guidance such as providing 
20110113140849.000|20110113140852.000|TR0|updated contact information.  Lawmakers 
20110113140852.000|20110113140854.000|TR0|are also being told to designate a contact 
20110113140854.000|20110113140857.000|TR0|in each office to coordinate security 
20110113140857.000|20110113140900.000|TR0|needs. And if members or their offices 
20110113140900.000|20110113140902.000|TR0|receive any kind of threat, they need to 
20110113140902.000|20110113140905.000|TR0|report it to a special division of the 
20110113140905.000|20110113140907.000|TR0|Capitol police.
20110113140907.000|20110113140910.000|TR0|
20110113140910.000|20110113140912.000|TR0|This just in to CNN.  The number of 
20110113140912.000|20110113140915.000|TR0|Americans filing jobless claims is up.  
20110113140915.000|20110113140917.000|TR0|445,000 people filed for unemployment 
20110113140917.000|20110113140920.000|TR0|benefits this week, ending January 8th.  
20110113140920.000|20110113140922.000|TR0|That's up 35,000 from the previous week's 
20110113140922.000|20110113140925.000|TR0|revised figure of 410,000 according to the 
20110113140925.000|20110113140927.000|TR0|Department of Labor.  The east coast of 
20110113140927.000|20110113140930.000|TR0|Australia looks like a war zone.  Swamped 
20110113140930.000|20110113140932.000|TR0|by a muddy wave of water.  The floods have 
20110113140932.000|20110113140935.000|TR0|actually been compared to Hurricane 
20110113140935.000|20110113140937.000|TR0|Katrina, called the worst natural disaster 
20110113140937.000|20110113140940.000|TR0|ever for the state of Queensland.  Fifteen 
20110113140940.000|20110113140942.000|TR0|people are dead, dozens are missing, more 
20110113140942.000|20110113140945.000|TR0|than 20,000 homes are flooded and waves 
20110113140945.000|20110113140948.000|TR0|are lapping up against -- skyscrapers, 
20110113140948.000|20110113140950.000|TR0|rather, in Brisbane.
20110113140950.000|20110113140953.000|TR0|
20110113140953.000|20110113140955.000|TR0|It looks like a ghost town after all the 
20110113140955.000|20110113140958.000|TR0|evacuations there.  The flood area 
20110113140958.000|20110113141000.000|TR0|stretches over an area the size of Germany 
20110113141000.000|20110113141003.000|TR0|and France combined. Recovery could take 
20110113141003.000|20110113141005.000|TR0|months, maybe even years, but leaders say 
20110113141005.000|20110113141008.000|TR0|that region will bounce back.
20110113141008.000|20110113141010.000|TR0|

20110113141048.000|20110113141051.000|TR0|PHIL BLACK, CNN CORRESPONDENT:  The 
20110113141051.000|20110113141053.000|TR0|Brisbane River is now dropping slowly.  It 
20110113141053.000|20110113141056.000|TR0|peaked at a level lower than was expected 
20110113141056.000|20110113141058.000|TR0|but still high enough to flood more than 
20110113141058.000|20110113141101.000|TR0|20,000 homes.  The people who lived in 
20110113141101.000|20110113141103.000|TR0|them are now scattered across the city 
20110113141103.000|20110113141106.000|TR0|staying in big evacuation centers as well 
20110113141106.000|20110113141108.000|TR0|as with family and friends.
20110113141108.000|20110113141111.000|TR0|
20110113141111.000|20110113141113.000|TR0|And for many of them it could be weeks 
20110113141113.000|20110113141116.000|TR0|before their homes are considered safe 
20110113141116.000|20110113141118.000|TR0|enough for them to return to.
20110113141118.000|20110113141121.000|TR0|

20110113144024.000|20110113144026.000|TR0|
20110113144026.000|20110113144029.000|TR0|Rob Marciano here to explain why it's time 
20110113144029.000|20110113144032.000|TR0|for a new direction.
20110113144032.000|20110113144034.000|TR0|
20110113144034.000|20110113144037.000|TR0|We're seeing a shift at the poles?
20110113144037.000|20110113144039.000|TR0|
20110113144039.000|20110113144042.000|TR0|ROB MARCIANO, AMS METEOROLOGIST:  Yes.  
20110113144042.000|20110113144044.000|TR0|Well, the North Pole, the magnetic North 
20110113144044.000|20110113144047.000|TR0|Pole I should say, which is different, of 
20110113144047.000|20110113144049.000|TR0|course, from the true North is constantly 
20110113144049.000|20110113144052.000|TR0|in motion.  And so much so, it's actually 
20110113144052.000|20110113144054.000|TR0|been speeding up lately.  And over the 
20110113144054.000|20110113144057.000|TR0|years, aviation has to take it into 
20110113144057.000|20110113144059.000|TR0|account and they have to rename their 
20110113144059.000|20110113144102.000|TR0|runways, basically, because every runway 
20110113144102.000|20110113144104.000|TR0|is based on a compass setting.  And when 
20110113144104.000|20110113144107.000|TR0|you hear a pilot say, I'm coming into 
20110113144107.000|20110113144109.000|TR0|runway 1-L Left, that means that they're 
20110113144109.000|20110113144112.000|TR0|coming into runway 1-L left, which means 
20110113144112.000|20110113144114.000|TR0|10 degrees, it's going into 10 degrees, 
20110113144114.000|20110113144117.000|TR0|which is pretty much just east of north.  
20110113144117.000|20110113144120.000|TR0|And if you're coming in the opposite 
20110113144120.000|20110113144122.000|TR0|direction, you're flying into 1-9 Right, 
20110113144122.000|20110113144125.000|TR0|coming down to the south.
20110113144125.000|20110113144127.000|TR0|
20110113144127.000|20110113144130.000|TR0|Well, this is the airport configuration of 
20110113144130.000|20110113144132.000|TR0|Tampa Airport.  These used to be zero and 
20110113144132.000|20110113144135.000|TR0|the top ones were 1-8, as in 180 degrees 
20110113144135.000|20110113144137.000|TR0|and 0 degrees. Well, this is all changing, 
20110113144137.000|20110113144140.000|TR0|and by the way, Reagan National just did 
20110113144140.000|20110113144142.000|TR0|this a few years ago.  Minneapolis did it 
20110113144142.000|20110113144145.000|TR0|about 10 or 15 years ago. This is all 
20110113144145.000|20110113144147.000|TR0|because magnetic North is on the move, my 
20110113144147.000|20110113144150.000|TR0|friends.  And since about 1831 tracking 
20110113144150.000|20110113144152.000|TR0|this.  And they literally go up there -- 
20110113144152.000|20110113144155.000|TR0|explorers do -- with planes, and they get 
20110113144155.000|20110113144157.000|TR0|up there, basically with a magnetic 
20110113144157.000|20110113144200.000|TR0|compass and try to figure out where the 
20110113144200.000|20110113144202.000|TR0|magnetic north is. And it's been on the 
20110113144202.000|20110113144205.000|TR0|move: 1948, 1972, getting a little bit 
20110113144205.000|20110113144208.000|TR0|closer to true North as we go on.  And 
20110113144208.000|20110113144210.000|TR0|2001, moving now, at anywhere from about 
20110113144210.000|20110113144213.000|TR0|25 to about 40 miles per year.
20110113144213.000|20110113144215.000|TR0|
20110113144215.000|20110113144218.000|TR0|And all of this, by the way, is because of 
20110113144218.000|20110113144220.000|TR0|the inner core of the earth is basically 
20110113144220.000|20110113144223.000|TR0|iron.  We've got solid iron on the inner 
20110113144223.000|20110113144225.000|TR0|core that spins at a slightly different 
20110113144225.000|20110113144228.000|TR0|rate than the earth on the outside.  And 
20110113144228.000|20110113144230.000|TR0|then you've got this liquid outer core.  
20110113144230.000|20110113144233.000|TR0|Because that's liquid and because it's 
20110113144233.000|20110113144235.000|TR0|metal, it has a charge to it.  And that 
20110113144235.000|20110113144238.000|TR0|constant motion of the liquid will 
20110113144238.000|20110113144240.000|TR0|actually change the magnetic field of the 
20110113144240.000|20110113144243.000|TR0|earth.  And a lot of scientists think that 
20110113144243.000|20110113144245.000|TR0|we may actually see a flip, where the 
20110113144245.000|20110113144248.000|TR0|North Pole will be on the South Pole and 
20110113144248.000|20110113144250.000|TR0|vice versa.
20110113144250.000|20110113144253.000|TR0|
20110113144253.000|20110113144256.000|TR0|So, interesting stuff.  You don't really 
20110113144256.000|20110113144258.000|TR0|have to worry about it too much if you 
20110113144258.000|20110113144301.000|TR0|have a GPS, because that, obviously is 
20110113144301.000|20110113144303.000|TR0|determined by satellites.  But if you are 
20110113144303.000|20110113144306.000|TR0|going old school on me and you're going up 
20110113144306.000|20110113144308.000|TR0|to the north Georgia mountains --
20110113144308.000|20110113144311.000|TR0|
20110113144311.000|20110113144313.000|TR0|PHILLIPS:  Oh, boy.
20110113144313.000|20110113144316.000|TR0|
20110113144316.000|20110113144318.000|TR0|MARCIANO:  -- and you got a compass out,
